Pivotal Weekly P.O.V. The latest Industry News, Features, and Blog Posts for goPivotal.com Week of July, 15 2013
Featured >>
Paul Maritz to talk about 'OS for the cloud' at CloudBeat 2013 <http://venturebeat.com/2013/07/25/pivotals-paul-maritz-to-talk-about-os-for-the-cloud-at-cloudbeat-2013/>
CloudBeat Conference <http://venturebeat.com/events/cloudbeat2013> will track the growing maturity of the cloud through two days of high-value discussions, case studies, breakout sessions, and panels featuring Paul Maritz and his vision for Pivotal's new product, Pivotal One <http://www.gopivotal.com/pivotal-products/pivotal-one>. Register now to receive a 25% off discount <http://cloudbeat2013.eventbrite.com/?discount=Pivotal>.
Latest Blog Posts >>
>> Cultivating Hybrids: 4 Key Data Architectures for Scaling Infinitely <http://blog.gopivotal.com/features/cultivating-hybrids-4-key-data-architectures-for-scaling-infinitely> One of the members of our advanced field engineering group shares how four types of systems - Hadoop, massively parallel processing (MPP) databases, NewSQL, and NoSQL - can be combined to achieve infinite scale.
>> How to Apply Messaging to Cloud Apps with RabbitMQ, Node.js, Redis, and More <http://blog.gopivotal.com/products/how-to-apply-messaging-to-cloud-apps-with-rabbitmq-node-js-redis-and-more> Developer advocate, Alvaro Videla, explains how to apply messaging in cloud-based, social apps like Instagram and provides detailed code examples with RabbitMQ Node.js, Sock.js, MongoDB, and Redis on Cloud Foundry.
